Detailed Description

template<class TBase>
class WTL::CStaticT< TBase >

The static control.

This class provides the functionality of a Windows static control. A static control is a control used to display text, to draw frames or lines separating other controls, or to display icons. A static control does not accept user input, but it can notify its parent of stylus taps if it is created with SS_NOTIFY style.

Definition at line 108 of file atlctrls.h.

Member Function Documentation

template<class TBase>
HWND WTL::CStaticT< TBase >::Create (  HWND    hWndParent,
_U_RECT    rect = NULL,
LPCTSTR    szWindowName = NULL,
DWORD    dwStyle = 0,
DWORD    dwExStyle = 0,
_U_MENUorID    MenuOrID = 0U,
LPVOID    lpCreateParam = NULL
)  [inline]
 

Creates a new static control.

This method creates a Windows static control and attaches it to the CStaticT object.

Parameters:
hWndParent  A Window handle to the parent/owner.
rect  Rectangle to size the control to.
szWindowName  Specifies the text to place in the control. If NULL, no text will be visible.
dwStyle  Specifies the static control window style. Apply any combination of static control styles to the control.
dwExStyle  Extended Window style.
MenuOrID  Specifies the static control control ID.
lpCreateParam  Optional creation parameter.
Returns:
The window handle of the new control.

Definition at line 114 of file atlctrls.h.

template<class TBase>
CBitmapHandle WTL::CStaticT< TBase >::SetBitmap (  HBITMAP    hBitmap )  [inline]
 

Sets the control bitmap.

This method associates a new bitmap with the static control.

The bitmap will be automatically drawn in the static control. By default, it will be drawn in the upper-left corner and the static control will be resized to the size of the bitmap.

Parameters:
hBitmap  Specifies the handle of the bitmap to be drawn in the static control.
Returns:
The handle of the bitmap previously associated with the static control, or NULL if no bitmap was associated with the static control.
